did.head: Collection Overview
did.unittitle: North American New Music Festival Sound Recordings, 1983-1993

origination.label: Creator
origination.corpname: North American New Music Festival (Buffalo, N.Y.)

did.physdesc: 10 boxes (390 cassettes, 22 reels and 1 container with 2 hard drives and accompanying documentation)
did.langmaterial: Spoken word content is in English.

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: State University of New York at Buffalo. Music Library

did.abstract: Contains sound recordings on 390 cassettes and 22 reels of performances from the North American New Music Festival, a series of annual festivals of contemporary art music sponsored by the University at Buffalo Department of Music from 1983 to 1993. The collection contains recordings of circa 720 musical works composed by about 334 different composers, including most of the most prominent composers of the 20th century. Many works were rehearsed and prepared with their respective composers in attendance and performers at the festival were chiefly specialists in new music.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Specified item], North American New Music Festival Sound Recordings, 1983-1993, Music Library, The State University of New York at Buffalo.

accessrestrict.head: Terms of Access
accessrestrict.p: Materials can be examined by qualified researchers in the Music Library during hours of operation during which Music Librarians are present. In order to insure access, researchers are advised to contact the Music Library in advance of visits.

userestrict.head: Copyright
userestrict.p: Copyright for the materials in the collection does not reside with the Music Library. Therefore, patrons wishing to publish any item, or part of an item from this collection for any purpose, are responsible for securing requisite permissions.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: The cassettes in the collection were copied circa 1996 from the originals held by the Music Department sound engineer. The reels were acquired from radio station WNED in Buffalo in 2017.

accruals.head: Accruals and Additions
accruals.p: No further accruals are expected to this collection.

altformavail.head: Alternate Forms
altformavail.p: The original recordings were made on cassettes. The contents were digitized onto hard drives. Preservation wav files were created to match the original cassette and reel faces. Digital files for the cassette are named with roots that match the tape numbering, for example ubmu0013_1_001a is the root file name for the digital files derived from Cassette 001 Side A. The digital files for the reels are numbered sequentially to follow the cassette numbering (digital files for cassettes are numbered 001-390; digital files for the reels are numbered 391-412). For the cassettes, service copies were created directly from the preservation masters. For the reels, intermediate Production master files were created to match the content, one file per musical work or spoken word segment. Service copies were derived from the Production masters.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Originally processed by Music Library staff. Processing in preparation for digitization by John Bewley.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: The North American New Music Festival was founded in 1983 by pianist/composerYvar Mikhashoff and percussionist Jan Williams, faculty members of the University at Buffalo Music Department and dedicated proponents of contemporary and avant-garde art music. Their aim was to produce, over a ten-day period, a concentrated series of concerts and related events at multiple Buffalo-area locations. These annual music festivals featured a wide range of modern musical styles composed and performed both by emerging creative musicians and by established composers of national and international reputation.

The Festivals were held in March or April in the years between 1983 and 1992, in October of 1993. Events took place in more than a dozen locations, including concert halls, art galleries, churches, theaters, and cabarets.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: Contains sound recordings on 390 cassettes and 22 reels of performances from the North American New Music Festival, a series of annual festivals of contemporary art music sponsored by the University at Buffalo Department of Music from 1983 to 1993. The collection contains recordings of circa 720 musical works composed by about 334 different composers, including most of the most prominent composers of the 20th century. Many works were rehearsed and prepared with their respective composers in attendance and the performers at the festival were chiefly specialists in new music. The works of more than 300 composers were presented, including many world premieres. In addition to the 720 musical works recorded, an additional 217 works were performed but not recorded.

item.ref: III. Hard drives and accompanying documentation

scopecontent.p: The sequence of 390 cassettes represents the principal portion of the collection, spanning the first concert in 1983 through the 200th and final concert in 1993.

arrangement.p: Arranged numerically by cassette number and listed by cassette sides. The numbering also reflects a chronological order.

scopecontent.p: The 22 reel to reel tapes were added to the collection after the cassette collection had been processed. All but one of these tapes were created by Buffalo public radio station, WNED. For some of the tapes, WNED recorded North American New Music Festival concerts with their own engineers and then added interviews and spoken introductions by program producer Leila Lustig. Some programs combined content from more than one North American New Music Festival concert, and one recording included content from outside the festival proper. WNED reels have been dated based on the date of the North American New Music Festival performance. The dates of production are unknown but presumably occurred shortyly after the concert dates.
The final tape in this series is a reel-to-reel recording of the performance of Stockhausen's Mantra, also available on Cassette 63.

arrangement.p: The WNED tapes are placed first, chiefly in chronological order, followed by the additional recording of Stockhausen's Mantra. The contents of the reels were numbered according to placement on the reel.

Gagaku (Musical Heritage Society 3031) ; Mel Powell: Haiku settings: Icy the moonshine (Nonesuch 78006) ; Gustav Holst: Japanese suite. scopecontent.p: Two hard drives containing reformatted digital audio and metadata files for the cassettes and reels respectively and a notebook binder containing photocopies of the Festival programs, list of concert dates, list of works performed, and scripts for the WNED radio programs.
Three-ring binder contains photocopies of the Festival programs, a list of concert dates, a list of works performed, and scripts for the WNED radio programs.

note.p: The following terms have been used to index the description of this collection in the Library's online catalog.

controlaccess.subject: Music--20th century
Music festivals--New York (State)--Buffalo
controlaccess.corpname: North American New Music Festival (Buffalo, N.Y.)

separatedmaterial.head: Separated Material
separatedmaterial.p: The following 217 musical works were performed during the North American New Music Festival but not recorded. In the original inventory they were assigned work numbers and were stated within the list where they chronologically occurred in the programming. The works are listed by the original numbering. They are included here to show the entire performed content of the festival. However, as a list of works never recorded, it does not truly represent anything physically separated from the collection.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Resources in the Music Library

defitem.label: North American New Music Festival Archive, 1983-1995Mus. Arc. 13
defitem.item: Finding aid for the administrative records and programs for the festival. It also includes a list of the photographs related to the festival.

label.archref: North American New Music Festival Catalog, 1983-1993

defitem.item: The original inventory of the cassette recordings. It follows the original numbering of works and includes works that were performed but not recorded.

label.archref: North American New Music Festival Archive Photographs

defitem.item: Digitized versions of the 173 photographs received with the Festival's papers.
